parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering shaft can cause the steering wheel to lock up or become loose, making it difficult or impossible to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
The failure of the ball joints can cause the steering to become erratic and the steering wheel to feel loose, making it difficult or impossible to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
The failure of the pitman arm can cause the steering to become loose or difficult to control, making it difficult or impossible to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.

The failure of the steering linkage/idler arm can cause the steering to become erratic and the steering wheel to feel loose, making it difficult or impossible to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
Other steering-related issues can cause the steering to become difficult or impossible to control, making it difficult or impossible to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Headlight lenses constantly turning yellow and cloudy
power window regulator cables constantly snapping
excessive play in the steering wheel

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Corroded brake lines can cause brake fluid leaks, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal sticks to the floor
grinding or rubbing noise when applying brakes.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: ABS failure can cause the vehicle to lose braking power, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: grinding or rubbing noise when applying brakes

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake master cylinder failure can cause the brake pedal to stick to the floor, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal sticks to the floor

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive brake rotor and pad wear can cause the vehicle to vibrate when braking, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: grinding or rubbing noise when applying brakes

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front suspension ball joint can cause the vehicle to lose steering control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle makes a loud noise when turning
the front end of the vehicle drops
and the ball joint breaks or separates from the socket.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the lower control arm can cause the vehicle to lose steering control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle makes a loud noise when turning
the front end of the vehicle drops
and the lower control arm breaks or separates from the socket.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The excessive noise and vibration from the front suspension can cause driver distraction, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle makes a loud noise when turning
the front end of the vehicle vibrates excessively
